Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility » Custom pages » Features available on custom pages

Access to the ODB from a Custom page



Access to the ODB is available using HTML tags and using JavaScript functions with the JavaScript built-in library mhttpd.js . Both methods are described in the following sections:

  • ODB access using HTML tags
  • ODB Access using mhttpd JavaScript built-in functions
  • Examples of accessing ODB from a Custom page
  • Features using ODB access from a Custom page

ODB access using HTML tags

The <odb...> tag has been defined for read/write access to the ODB under HTML. Also shown in the table below is the equivalent JavaScript function.

that the <odb...> tags and JavaScript equivalent must be declared within enclosing HTML <form...>....</form> tags (see above).

Above: Access to ODB from HTML

HTML ODB tag

Meaning

Equivalent JS function

<odb src="odb path">

Display ODB field (read only)

ODBGet

<odb src="odb path" edit=1 pwd="CustomPwd">

Display an Editable ODB field (inline style). Optional password protection with pwd .


<odb src="odb path" edit=2 pwd="CustomPwd" >

Display an Editable ODB field (popup style). Optional password protection with pwd .

ODBEdit

Usage: 

Experiment Name: <odb src="/Experiment/Name">
Run Number: <odb src="/runinfo/run number" edit=1>

Examples

  1. The following image shows the status of the ODB key /logger/write data:

    ODB access using <odb..> tag

    The HTML code fragment producing the image above is shown below:

    <table style="text-align: center; width: 40%;" border="1" cellpadding="2"
cellspacing="2">
<tr><td style="vertical-align: top; background-color: lightyellow; text-align: center;">
Logging data</td>
<td><odb src="/logger/write data">
</td></tr</table>

  2. Example of ODB access with HTML and JavaScript equivalent



ODB Access using mhttpd JavaScript built-in functions

The following mhttpd JS built-in functions are defined for ODB access:

  • ODBGet
  • ODBEdit
  • ODBSet
  • ODBKey

Examples:

  1. As in the HTML example above, the status of the ODB key /logger/write data is displayed in the following image, but in this case the background colour is changed (using Javascript) depending on the value of the key:

    ODB access using ODBGet showing colour change depending on state of ODB variable



    The code fragment for the above images is shown below: 

    <script>
var wd= ODBGet('/logger/write data')
alert ('wd = '+wd);
</script>
<table style="text-align: center; width: 40%;" border="1" cellpadding="2"
cellspacing="2">
<tr>
<td style="vertical-align: top; background-color:  lightyellow; text-align: center;">Logging data</td>
<script>
if (wd == "y")
   document.write('<td style="vertical-align: top; background-color: lime; text-align: center;">'+wd);
else
   document.write('<td style="vertical-align: top; background-color: red; text-align: center;">'+wd);
</script>
</td></tr></table>

  2. Example of ODB access with HTML and JavaScript equivalent
  3. Example of ODB access with JavaScript functions ODBSet and ODBKey
Note:
The built-in library must be included in your custom page when using any of the JS built-in functions.



ODBGet JavaScript function

Above: Access to ODB from JavaScript

JavaScript Function

Purpose

Parameters

ODBGet(path, format, defval, len, type)

Retrieves individual or array values from the ODB.

path

ODB path

format

optional format to write out value read from ODB. Do not include spaces.

defval

Value to write if creating the key.

len

Key length to use if creating the key.

type

Type to use if creating the key. One of the MIDAS Type definitions (see MIDAS Data Types).

Usage: ODBGet works in a similar way to db_set_value() . If the path does not exist, it will be created and set to the supplied value (providing the last 3 parameters are supplied).
For example, use ODBGet(<path>) to obtain a value. If <path> points to an array in the ODB, an individual value can be retrieved by using an index, e.g. 

  ODBGet('/Equipment/Environment/Variables/Input[3]');

or the complete array can be obtained with 

  ODBGet('/Equipment/Environment/Variables/Input[*]');

The function then returns a JavaScript array which can be used like 

  var a = ODBGet('/Equipment/Environment/Variables/Input[*]');

  for (i=0 ; i<a.length ; i++)
    alert(a[i]);

If no <format> parameter is supplied, a default format is used. The following shows the use of a format parameter: 

path='/runinfo/run number';
rn = ODBGet(path,"%4.4d\n");

Example

  • Example of ODB access with HTML and JavaScript equivalent



ODBEdit JavaScript function

Above: Access to ODB from JavaScript

JavaScript Function

Purpose

Parameters

ODBEdit(path)

Display an Editable ODB field (popup style)

path

ODB path

Usage: 

document.writeln('Edit Run Number:')
document.writeln('<a href="#" onclick="ODBEdit(path)" >')
document.writeln(rn)
document.writeln('</a>');

Example

  • Example of ODB access with HTML and JavaScript equivalent



ODBSet JavaScript function

Above: Access to ODB from JavaScript

JavaScript Function

Purpose

Parameters

ODBSet(path, value, pwdname)

Set one ODB value or an array of values (see note)

path

ODB path

value

Set value or array of values

pwdname

Password (needed if web security is set up).

Writing arrays with ODBSet has been available since May 2010 .
Usage: Individual ODB values can be set in the background with ODBSet(<path>,<value> or ODBSet(<path>,<value>,<password_name>)

If using a password, the <password_name> must be defined as an ODB entry (see Password protection of ODB variables accessed from a custom page)

Example

  • Example of ODB access with HTML and JavaScript equivalent
  • Example of ODB access with arrays



ODBKey JavaScript function

Above: Access to ODB from JavaScript

JavaScript Function

Purpose

Parameters

ODBKey(path)

Get the structure of an ODB key. Returns the key name,type,number of values and size.

path

ODB path

Usage: 

key = ODBKey('/Experiment/Name');
document.write('key array : '+key+'<br>');

Example:

  • Example of ODB access with JavaScript functions ODBSet and ODBKey
  • Examples of accessing ODB from a Custom page
